geopolitics.title: Mark Cuban Faces 9-Figure Decision Over Mavs as Bidding War Awaits In Dallas
geopolitics.description: Almost a year after the Luka Doncic trade, Mark Cuban was approached to reestablish control within the Dallas Mavericks.

geopolitics.title: US Vice President Vance heads to Armenia, Azerbaijan to push peace, trade
geopolitics.description: By Lucy PapachristouTBILISI, Feb 9 (Reuters) - U.S. Vice President JD Vance will visit Armenia and Azerbaijan this week to push a Washington-brokered peace agreement that could transform energy and trade routes in the strategic South Caucasus region.His two-day trip to Armenia, which begins later on Monday, comes just six months after the Armenian and Azerbaijani leaders signed an agreement at the White House seen as the first step towards peace after nearly 40 years of war.

geopolitics.title: India Pulls Back From Russian Oil as U.S. Trade Deal Nears
geopolitics.description: Indian refiners are reducing purchases of Russian crude ahead of a U.S.-India trade deal, a shift that could tighten crude markets and support higher global oil prices amid intensifying Western sanctions on Moscow.

geopolitics.title: Trump: China's Xi to Visit US 'Toward the End of the Year'
geopolitics.description: President Donald Trump has said he will host Chinese leader Xi Jinping at the White House late this year, as the world's top two economies look to reset ties marred by a roiling trade war.

geopolitics.title: US Olympians speaking up about politics at home face backlash; Trump calls one ‘a real Loser’
geopolitics.description: Support for the U.S. abroad has eroded as the Trump administration has pursued an aggressive posture on foreign policy, including punishing tariffs, military action in Venezuela and threats to invade Greenland.

geopolitics.title: D.C. lobbyists have been the biggest winners of Trump’s trade wars - The Washington Post
geopolitics.description: The biggest winner of a trade war is the swamp.

geopolitics.title: EU Escalates Oil Sanctions With Broad Ban on Shipping Services
geopolitics.description: The European Union is preparing to take a much bigger swing at Russia’s oil trade, and this time Brussels is aiming less at optics and more at the plumbing that actually keeps barrels moving.

geopolitics.title: Washington Targets Tankers Keeping Iranian Crude Moving
geopolitics.description: Washington moved to tighten the screws on Iran’s oil trade again on Friday, rolling out a fresh batch of sanctions aimed squarely at the shadow fleet that keeps Tehran’s barrels moving when they’re not supposed to be.

crypto.description: South Korea’s Financial Supervisory Service (FSS) has reportedly initiated a formal investigation into Bithumb, a local cryptocurrency exchange, following a massive $40 billion accidental Bitcoin

crypto.title: Bitcoin At $68,000 As Ethereum, XRP, Dogecoin Stabilize Ahead Of Economic Data
crypto.description: Bitcoin is holding near $68,000 as liquidations stand at $249.25 million over the past 24 hours. Bitcoin ETFs saw $145 million in net inflows on Monday, while Ethereum ETFs reported $57.05 million in net inflows.

crypto.title: Crypto Markets Today
crypto.description: Bitcoin was little changed Tuesday, while ether fell. CoinDesk's memecoin Index rose.

commodities.title: Wall Street braces for more pain in the face of market rebound Friday
commodities.description: Recent action in the metals markets — gold, silver and copper — may also herald more violent price moves, JPMorgan said.

commodities.title: Precious metals, oil slide as global tensions ease; copper down
commodities.description: Prices of commodities, from silver and gold to crude oil and copper, dived on Thursday, as global tensions eased after a telephone call between the leaders of China and the United States, which is also set for talks with Iran this week.

commodities.title: ETF’s Jump Back into Silver & Gold Pushes through $5000! Will it last?
commodities.description: ETFs move back into silver as gold pushes through $5,000, with Phil Streible breaking down the price action on Metals Minute. Tune in before the bell.

commodities.title: Stocks, gold, and silver steady after overnight volatility
commodities.description: The center of the action in markets was again precious metals, where momentum suddenly halted after gold’s price roughly doubled in 12 months.

commodities.title: Gold and Silver Price Crashes Not a Moment to Buy the Dip, Pros Say
commodities.description: Gold and silver crashed on Friday, but analysts caution that the dramatic declines might not be a moment to buy the dip in the precious metals.

commodities.title: Commodities Slump Rattles Markets As Gold, Silver, Oil Sell-Off Deepens
commodities.description: Gold prices slid about 9% to their lowest level in more than two weeks, while silver fell more than 13% after both metals hit record highs last week.

commodities.title: Slump in commodities rattles global markets
commodities.description: Commodities markets slumped on Monday, led by deep losses in gold, silver, oil and industrial metals, as a selloff ​unleashed by President Donald Trump's choice of Kevin Warsh for the next U.S. Fed chair sent precious metals tumbling for a second session.

ai_tech.title: Consumer research startup Justpoint launches Arizona law firm
ai_tech.description: A venture capital-backed startup that says it uses artificial intelligence to identify toxins in drugs and other products through medical records said on Tuesday that it has opened an Arizona-based law firm to represent clients directly in mass tort litigation.

ai_tech.title: Andreessen Horowitz’s Rising Influence Over Trump-Era AI Policy
ai_tech.description: One of Silicon Valley’s most storied venture capital firms has emerged as a hidden hand steering artificial intelligence policy in Washington, as President Donald Trump embraces the industry’s relentless push into the emerging technology.

ai_tech.title: Missouri Senate considers limits on AI personhood, deepfakes
ai_tech.description: Missouri lawmaker seek label artificial intelligence systems as "non-sentient entities."

ai_tech.title: Alphabet sells bonds worth $20 billion to fund AI spending
ai_tech.description: Alphabet has sold bonds worth $20 billion in a seven-part offering stretching out to 2066, tapping the debt market to fund its surging spending on artificial intelligence infrastructure.

ai_tech.title: What to know about Elon Musk's merger of SpaceX with his AI company
ai_tech.description: The merger of SpaceX and xAi will finance Elon Musk's artificial intelligence ambitions, including a futuristic plan to blast a million satellite data centers into orbit.

ai_tech.title: Wall Street is searching for AI winners and losers
ai_tech.description: For years, anything exposed to artificial intelligence was a popular trade on Wall Street. Now investors are starting to get selective, demanding more proof that companies are poised to benefit from the AI boom.

ai_tech.title: How the use of AI and 'deepfakes' play a role in the search for Nancy Guthrie
ai_tech.description: As artificial intelligence becomes more advanced and commonplace, it can be difficult to know what's real and what's not, which has complicated the search for Nancy Guthrie, according to law enforcement. But just how difficult is it?

ai_tech.title: An ugly split in the AI industry is shaping the race to replace Nadler
ai_tech.description: Top artificial intelligence executives are spending big against Democratic House candidate Alex Bores. But his campaign is also raking in donations from AI experts and tech employees.
